title: 110_s2455
content:
The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" may be cited as the short title. Additional emergency CDBG funding is addressed in the Act. The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" authorizes $1 billion for community development block grants to assist with housing foreclosures and provide rental assistance for individual renters. Funds cannot be used for homeowner foreclosure prevention purposes, except for counseling services. The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" authorizes $1 billion for community development block grants to assist with housing foreclosures and provide rental assistance for individual renters. Funds can be given directly to certified housing counseling services approved by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. SEC. 3. INCREASED PUBLIC SERVICES REQUIREMENT CAP.

Paragraph (8) of section 105(a) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to increase the requirement from "15 percent" to "25 percent" for the use of funds under this Act.

SEC. 4. LOW AND MODERATE INCOME REQUIREMENT.

At least 50 percent of the funds under this Act must primarily benefit low- and moderate-income individuals.

SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS. SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS.

States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties must submit a comprehensive plan for fund usage approval. They also need to provide quarterly reports detailing the expenditure of funds. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development has the authority to waive certain provisions of statutes or regulations to facilitate the use of funds by States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties. Waivers can be granted for low and moderate-income requirements and public services caps upon request and demonstration of a compelling need. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive public service requirement caps upon request from States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties if a compelling need is shown. Waivers must be published in the Federal Register at least 5 days before taking effect, reviewed every 2 years, and reported to the Senate and House Committees on Appropriations. The House of Representatives must be informed of any waiver granted or denied under this section at least 5 days before it is approved or rejected. SEC. 7. Noncompliance with community development requirements under this Act will be subject to the provisions of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. SEC. 8. The Comptroller General will conduct an audit of all funds appropriated under this Act and submit a report to the Senate and House Committees. SEC. 9. Reports will be provided as required. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must report quarterly to the Senate and House Committees on the use of funds, including the number of households receiving counseling and rental assistance, outcomes of assistance activities, certified housing counseling services, steps taken to prevent fraud and abuse.
